intro: Hieracium iseranum subsp. anguinescens, commonly known as the angular hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and leaves that are often hairy and have a rough texture. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster, typical of the daisy family. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in grassy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
